items.title: Specialist police teams fly in to hunt suspect after three shot dead
items.description: Tactical police and military personnel join a growing air and land search for a man police have identified after three people were shot dead in a remote New South Wales town on Thursday.

items.title: Defiant Sussan Ley downplays Nationals' exit, vows to remain leader
items.description: The Liberal leader did not speak about the Nationals' decision to terminate the Coalition on yesterday's National Day of Mourning, but on Friday insisted her focus was on the government.

items.title: Live: Littleproud says reports he yelled at Ley over phone are 'nonsense'
items.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud says he is open to working with Liberal leader Sussan Ley again "at some point", but right now the two parties need "a bit of time apart". Follow live.

items.title: One Nation's rise in popularity changes the context of the Coalition's divorce
items.description: It is impossible to view this week’s events without the broader context of the relationship between the Liberals and the Nationals, how the electoral map is changing and what that means for right-wing politics in Australia.

items.title: Trump touts 'total access' Greenland deal as NATO asks allies to step up
items.description: The leaders of both Denmark and Greenland say they are not aware of what is in the deal, announced by the US president earlier this week.

items.title: Osaka apologises for 'disrespectful' interview comments aimed at opponent
items.description: Naomi Osaka walks back her aggressive retort to a tense handshake between her and second-round opponent Sorana Cirstea.

items.title: Anger and confusion after Australian courier Sendle collapses
items.description: The Australian company's customers feel like they have been "ghosted", while investors and shareholders are angry and confused about what happens next.

items.title: Live: Australian dollar hits 15-month highs, gold breaches $US4,900
items.description: The Australian share market is likely to open flat despite a rally on Wall Street, as investors showed signs of relief a day after US President Donald Trump dropped tariff threats against eight European countries and ruled out seizing Greenland by force. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

items.title: Catastrophic fire danger as seven-day heatwave engulfs south-east states
items.description: South-east states are predicted to bake through a prolonged severe heatwave from Saturday onwards, which has the potential to break all-time temperature records and fuel another round of dangerous bushfires.

items.title: 'Hug your babies': Search continues for people buried under NZ landslide
items.description: Specialist officers have worked through the night with earthmoving equipment to try and find those trapped under the rubble at a popular tourist spot on New Zealand's North Island.

items.title: Venezuela built a retail mecca. Then it became a notorious 'torture prison'
items.description: Nestled among shanty homes, mountains and forests, a giant building once touted to become Venezuela's world-leading retail mecca later turned into a centre for alleged human rights abuses.

items.title: David Speirs's political comeback in doubt as public funding ruled out
items.description: Former opposition leader David Speirs would "not fulfil the nomination requirements" if he applied to be a candidate at the upcoming state election, the state's electoral commission says, raising significant doubts about his chances of a political comeback.

items.title: Officers fire shots as police car is rammed in Melbourne
items.description: Police say officers shot at a four-wheel drive, which was allegedly driven at two officers in Dandenong on Thursday night.

items.title: Op shop at risk of closure after 'abhorrent' donation traumatises volunteer
items.description: The future of a Victorian op shop is in doubt after a worker opened a bag containing the stuff of nightmares, leading to the destruction of stock and hefty cleaning bills that may prove to be a deadly financial blow.

items.title: Ancient DNA in Colombian skeleton may reveal clues to origin of syphilis
items.description: A previously unknown strain of syphilis bacteria has been discovered in human remains in Colombia, dating back 5,500 years.

items.title: Aussies soar, Wicked gone for good and other Oscar nomination surprises and snubs
items.description: Hybrid horror Sinners came up as the big winner in the 98th Academy Award nominations, with Aussie actors also eyeing up gold, and Wicked: For Good wiped off the map.

items.title: Fiji fishermen help catch alleged $780m cocaine shipment involving 'narco sub'
items.description: Fijian chiefs reported suspicious activity along their stretch of coastline to law enforcement agencies — which then swooped on an alleged $780 million drug operation.

items.title: Zelenskyy flags talks with US, Russia, says Europe is 'lost' dealing with Trump
items.description: The Kremlin is yet to comment on the Ukrainian president's announcement, made at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

items.title: Everything you need to know about triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025
items.description: Australia's favourite music poll is back for another year — here's when it happens and how to listen.

items.title: Climate change 'made January heatwave five times more likely'
items.description: A study by World Weather Attribution has analysed temperatures during the intense early January heatwave. It found that what was once a rare event is now happening far more often.

items.title: Record heat forecast for Adelaide on Australia Day, SA fire warnings issued
items.description: The South Australian Country Fire Service is urging people to reconsider travelling to the Yorke Peninsula over the long weekend and Adelaide is forecast to have its hottest Australia Day on record.

items.title: After '14 years deprived of joy', Raqqa locals hope Syria's wars are finally over
items.description: Syrian government forces have wrested back control of vast parts of its territory in recent weeks, as a new president moves to assert control over the war-torn country.

items.title: French navy seizes suspected Russian 'shadow fleet' oil tanker
items.description: The move is the latest by Western allies to crack down on a so-called "shadow fleet" of tankers suspected of carrying Russian oil against international sanctions.

items.title: Death toll from Spanish high-speed train disaster rises to 45
items.description: Train drivers in the country are striking after a string of rail accidents in less than a week.

items.title: Pakistan shopping centre fire has killed at least 55, authorities confirm
items.description: Investigators are continuing to search for others who died in the disaster, with authorities yet to announce what caused the blaze.
